data.title: Why Zac Efron Regretted Starring In High School Musical

data.text:
Publish date: 2024-05-28

The likelihood is that maximum millennials can be able to remember a time once they have been obsessed with High School Musical. The tv musical, which aired on Disney Channel in 2006, turned into a pop culture phenomenon and introduced its young stars to international fame almost right away.

Zac Efron and Vanessa Hudgens, who had been on-screen fans in the film, even began dating in genuine existence soon after, cementing their status as one of the vital popular couples in Hollywood.

To this present day, High School Musical remains considered one of Zac Efronâs highest-grossing musicals. Thereâs certainly that appearing in the film and its sequels modified Efronâs occupation and opened him as much as new alternatives. However, that doesnât mean that the big name appears to be like again fondly on his time as Troy Bolton.

Opening as much as Menâs Fitness, Efron delivered some home truths about his genuine thoughts on having starred in the franchise.

Zac Efron Led âHigh School Musicalâ

The first installment of the mega-popular High School Musical franchise used to be launched in 2006. Starring the then-unknown Zac Efron, Vanessa Hudgens, and Ashley Tisdale, the tv musical is often regarded as a contemporary adaptation of Romeo and Juliet.

RELATED: Zac Efron Called This His Worst On-Set Kissing Scene

Troy Bolton, a high school basketball player, and Gabriella Montez, a transfer pupil with a skill for math and science, to find common ground when they are each cast in the high school musical.

Some critics have also when compared the film to Grease, since it involves two high school students from rival cliques who fall in love, a lot to the dismay of their classmates.

Zac Efronâs Role In âHigh School Musicalâ

Zac Efron changed into a teen heartthrob when he gained the role of Troy Bolton in High School Musical. His real-life relationship with Vanessa Hudgens, who portrayed his on-screen love passion Gabriella, additionally helped to turn both Efron and Hudgens into two of the most popular young stars in Hollywood.

Although Efron had been appearing all through the 2000s, it wasnât until 2006 that he made his giant smash and received popularity amongst teenage audiences. Starring in High School Musical modified the actorâs existence, however does he remorseful about it?

Did Zac Efron Regret Starring In âHigh School Musicalâ

In a confession that will break millennial hearts all over the world, Zac Efron reportedly instructed Menâs Fitness that he does regret starring in the franchise. According to Nova F.M., he âneeds he may just go back in time and inform his teenage-self not to do it.â

RELATED: Zac Efron Got Caught 'Sneaking a Peek' With This Actress

âI step back and take a look at myself and I nonetheless want to kick that manâs a** from time to time,â he said of himself in the film. âLike, f*** that guy. Heâs completed some roughly cool things with some other peopleâhe did that one thing that used to be humorous, but I imply heâs still just that f****** kid from High School Musical.â

Why Did Zac Efron Regret Starring In The Franchise?

Elaborating on his emotions, Efron revealed that starring in the franchise just wasnât what he wanted to be doing on the time.

The megastar printed to Menâs Fitness that he knew once he had completed one High School Musical movie that the flicks werenât right for him. "I was, like, 17. And I said, âGuys, you know this is not at all what I want to do?â And they were like, âReally?ââ

Despite his true feelings about starring in the franchise, Efron stuck with it and reprised his role for High School Musical 2, and High School Musical 3: Senior Year.

Zac Efron Took The World By Storm

After Efron was catapulted to fame, he appeared in a few other films that were super-popular amongst teen audiences. In 2007, he appeared in another musical film, Hairspray, then later starred in 17 Again, alongside Mathew Perry, and Charlie St. Cloud.

RELATED: What Really Happened To Zac Efron's Face?

At the height of his teen heartthrob status, Efron was an idol to teenagers all around the world. Even celebrities have admitted that they were majorly crushing on the High School Musical star.

At the GQ Man of the Year party in 2008, Megan Fox gave an interview on the red carpet and was told Zac Efron was attending the event. She confessed that she was obsessed with him at the time, adding, ââHeâs here? What you donât know is Zac Efron and I are the same person.â

Some fans believe that she was joking, but if Fox really did have a crush on Efron at the time, she wouldnât have been the only one!

What Has Zac Efron Done Since âHigh School Musicalâ

Zac Efron has appeared in several other projects since his High School Musical days. In particular, heâs starred in a few films that have worked to help dismantle his teenage heartthrob image, including Neighbors in 2014 and 2015âs Dirty Grandpa (along with many other celebrities!).

In 2019, Efron starred in Extremely Wicked, Shockingly Evil, and Vile, as the serial killer Ted Bundy.
